basics.name: Nicholas Moline
basics.label: Engineering Leader
basics.summary: Experienced Engineering Leader with a demonstrated history of working in the internet industry. Skilled in PHP, JavaScript, Go, and Python. Strong engineering professional with over 2 decades of experience in developing for the internet.

work.name: Jobscan
highlights: Responsible for the technical direction of the company, and for the technical decisions made by the team.
Built up a strong leadership team to support the company's growth.
work.summary: Team Lead for Jobscan's Engineering Team, leading projects and guiding team members as we work to help job seekers everywhere. Also responsible for the hiring and onboarding of new team members.

work.name: Jobscan
work.position: Technical Lead / Interim Head of Engineering
highlights: Led Jobscan's team through development and deployment of multiple initiatives including Jobscan's Job Tracker and their Chrome Extension.
Led IT team through migration from individual servers to containers on AWS ECS with auto-scaling, and continuous deployment through Github Actions and AWS Codebuild.
Served as temporary head of Product, while interviewing and hiring a new Product Manager.
work.summary: Promoted to Technical Lead to lead small team of Engineers within Jobscan's Engineering Team.  When our CTO departed shortly after I was promited, I stepped in as Interim Head of Engineering leading the entire Engineering team and acting in a leadership capacity for all technical decisions made at Jobscan.

work.name: Jobscan
work.summary: Did Full Stack development as a member of Jobscan's Engineering Team.
highlights: Ported Jobscan's development infrastructure to Docker powered containers.
Ported core web-app to a Laravel backed API, which serves a Vue.js powered Single Page Application (SPA).
Created new codebase to use for evaluating potential new employees.
Upgraded Email Security to use DKIM, DMARC, and BIMI standards.

work.name: Ezoic
work.summary: Member of Ezoic's site performance team, developing new features and improving existing features related to site performance.  Development in Go, PHP, and Javascript (Vue.js).  Implemented new API for CDN cache invalidation and a wordpress plugin that uses this API to allow users to invalidate the CDN cache from within the wordpress admin panel.

work.name: Sunnyvale Community Players
work.position: Board of Directors Member & Show Techniclal Staff
highlights: Served as Producer for four live theater productions.
Sound Designer for seven live musical productions.
Designed and built custom IoT devices to provide wireless visual effects for shows.
Member of the Board of Directors from 2018 through 2020, serving different roles including Web Committee Chairman, Board Secretary, and Board Vice President.
work.summary: Experienced in many aspects of theatrical design and operations.  Served varied roles during the productions of over a dozen shows.  Such roles include: Producer, Audio Engineer, Sound Designer, and Special Effects Designer.

work.name: Justia Inc.
highlights: Designed and developed multiple user-friendly web applications, including Justia Dockets, Justia Lawyer Directory, and BlawgSearch.
Represented Justia at conferences around the country.
Wrote over 70 articles for the Justia Legal Marketing and Technology Blog.
work.summary: As a Senior Software Engineer for Justia, I serve as web developer and network engineer. Participated as initial lead developer in release of several of Justia's Free Legal Information projects.  Manage and oversee groundwork for working with the AWS Cloud and configuring servers for a variety of projects and environments.

work.name: Want a Better Website, Inc
work.summary: As a Web Programmer for Want a Better Website, Inc., I created dynamic web properties based on PHP for web design clients. Designed and developed interactive websites while ensuring high traffic, user experience, and page views. Supervised and led front-end development and provided assistance with back-end programming for website. Trained, coached, and mentored junior staff while ensuring best practice workmanship.

work.name: PortalKeeper Inc.
work.summary: Founder, I established and successfully ran the company while ensuring streamlining of all operations. Delivered network and IT consulting services for small businesses in DFW area and Ran Linux systems for advanced web hosting services.

work.name: Get on the Air, Inc.
highlights: Mapped and planned long range wireless shots taking into consideration terrain, foilage, and other obstacles.
Designed and implemented server and physical and wireless networking infrastructure.
work.summary: Spearheaded the Western Carolina Wireless project on a Rural Initiative grant from the state of North Carolina.  Designed long range wifi network with largest network hop of over 10 miles.  Also provided second level technical support to wireless internet clients.  Developed and maintained a public Internet resource center where citizens of Graham County, North Carolina could access high-speed internet at no charge.

work.name: Metrotime Business Systems
work.summary: Maintained Metrotime's office networking, designed and maintained Metrotime's Website, provided IT and networking consulting services to Metrotime's clients, installing and optimizing networks for businesses around the DFW Metroplex

work.name: 5GuysTech LLC
work.summary: Co-founded web hosting and web development company out of Poulsbo, WA.  Was responsible for maintaining linux servers and developing and maintaining websites, billing systems and database applications.

volunteer.summary: Built custom templating system based on a WordPress backend, but with a completely custom set of content types and templates.  Also built custom search engine and custom content management system.  Maintained and updated the site for over 10 years.
